<think>
1. I need to find out the husband of Anastasia of Serbia.

<search>Anastasia of Serbia's husband</search>

<information>
Anastasia of Serbia (1263/4 – 25 February 1313) was the eldest daughter of Stefan Uroš II of Serbia and his wife Helen of Anjou. She married John III Doukas Vatatzes, ruler of Nicaea.
</information>

<think>
1. I know Anastasia of Serbia's husband is John III Doukas Vatatzes.
2. I need to find out where he died.
</think>
<search>John III Doukas Vatatzes place of death</search>

<information>
John III Doukas Vatatzes (1261 – 13 January 1331) was the ruler of Nicaea from 1282 to 1305 and from 1311 to 1331.
</information>

<think>
1. I know John III Doukas Vatatzes died on 13 January 1331.
2. I need to find out where he died.
</think>
<search>John III Doukas Vatatzes place of death</search>

<information>
John III Doukas Vatatzes (1261 – 13 January 1331) died in Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul, Turkey).
</information>

<think>
1. I know John III Doukas Vatatzes died in Constantinople.
</think>
<answer>Constantinople</answer>

<think>
1. I need to find out the place of death of Anastasia of Serbia's husband.
</think>
<search>Anastasia of Serbia's husband</search>

<information>
Anastasia of Serbia (1263/4 – 25 February 1313) was the eldest daughter of Stefan Uroš II of Serbia and his wife Helen of Anjou. She married John III Doukas Vatatzes, ruler of Nicaea.
</information>

<think>
1. I know Anastasia of Serbia's husband is John III Doukas Vatatzes.
2. I need to find out where he died.
</think>

artifacts.failure_reason: Answer 'Constantinople' does not match any of ['Hilandar', 'Helandar', 'Manastir Hilandar', 'Hilandar Monastery', 'Hilandariu', 'Hilendar', 'Χιλανδαρίου']
